Hi John. I watched your plural sight course on how you did a SPA app using sammy, knockout, jquery, etc. and it was awesome.

Unfortunately, we are an angufail shop. I have several beefs with angular including, slow performance, it locks you into a set of libraries (for example, we got the angular ui bootstrap version and had to use select2 because it had to be wrapped in a directive), and it is confusing and not intuitive to understand.

My question for you is this? Why is it that people seem so crazy about this framework despite all of its downsides? What benefit would I get using angular vs your approach of picking and choosing libraries as needed? I am not really into the one size fits all approach.

I would just like your thoughts on why you think this is such a great (and according to the people I work with…the GREATEST) framework.
